      java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList> getStops() 
      void setLinearGradient(HILinearGradient linearGradient)
      Definition of the gradient, similar to SVG: object literal holds start position (x1, y1) and the end position (x2, y2) relative to the shape, where 0 means top/left and 1 is bottom/right.
      void setStops(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList> stops)
      The stops is an array of tuples, where the first item is a float between 0 and 1 assigning the relative position in the gradient, and the second item is the color.

      • setLinearGradient

        public void setLinearGradient(HILinearGradient linearGradient)
        Definition of the gradient, similar to SVG: object literal holds start position (x1, y1) and the end position (x2, y2) relative to the shape, where 0 means top/left and 1 is bottom/right. All positions are floats between 0 and 1.

      • getLinearGradient

        public HILinearGradient getLinearGradient()

      • setStops

        public void setStops(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList> stops)
        The stops is an array of tuples, where the first item is a float between 0 and 1 assigning the relative position in the gradient, and the second item is the color.

        default:

         [[0, #ffffff], [1, #e6e6e6]]
